questions.Q: The graph shows the position against time for a body moving along x-axis. The speed of the body at $$t=8\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: The speed is given by the slope of the curve at $$t=8\,\text{s}$$, which is $$-\frac{8}{3}\,\text{m/s}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity against time for a body moving along x-axis. The displacement of the body for the time interval $$t=0$$ to $$t=10\,\text{s}$$ is:
questions.E: The displacament is given by the area under the curve, i.e., $$\text{area of the shaded trapezoid}=\Delta x=\frac{1}{2}(4\,\text{s})(10\,\text{s})(8\,\text{m/s})=56\,\text{m}$$

questions.Q: The graph shows the velocity against time for a body moving along x-axis. The displacement of the body for the first three seconds is:
questions.E: The displacament is given by the area under the curve, i.e., $$\text{area of the shaded triangle}=\Delta x =\frac{1}{2}(3\,\text{s})(8\,\text{m/s})=12\,\text{m}$$
